bug.short_desc: Test case 232 fails with "torture_indom failed for mem.slabinfo.objects.total"
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
[root@ibm-p8-06-lp8 testsuite]# ./check 232 PMDA probe: pminfo -h ibm-p8-06-lp8.klab.eng.bos.redhat.com -f sample.milliseconds PMDA probe: pminfo -h ibm-p8-06-lp8.klab.eng.bos.redhat.com -f sampledso.milliseconds PMDA probe: pminfo -h ibm-p8-06-lp8.klab.eng.bos.redhat.com -f simple.numfetch 232 - output mismatch (see 232.out.bad) 14a15,16 > number of instances for unprofiled fetch (117) != that for the profiled fetch (0) > torture_indom failed for mem.slabinfo.objects.total
Check local PMCD is still alive ... PMDA probe: pminfo -h ibm-p8-06-lp8.klab.eng.bos.redhat.com -f sample.milliseconds PMDA probe: pminfo -h ibm-p8-06-lp8.klab.eng.bos.redhat.com -f sampledso.milliseconds PMDA probe: pminfo -h ibm-p8-06-lp8.klab.eng.bos.redhat.com -f simple.numfetch Failures: 232 Failed 1 of 1 tests [root@ibm-p8-06-lp8 testsuite]#
Observed on ppc64/ppc64le.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
pcp-3.11.7-1.fc25
How reproducible:
Steps to Reproduce: 1. 2. 3.
Actual results:
Expected results:
Additional info:
Thanks Milos - this is resolved now by upstream commit 93dcf14 (libpcp: ensure correct ctx number passed for local contexts).
